Key Match Events: Scotland made 90/0 in a rain-shortened 10-over innings.
Mark Wood had George Munsey caught only for the delivery to be called a no-ball.
Michael Jones launched a huge six into the roof of the Kensington Oval.
Scotland finished on 90/0 after ten overs, with Jones hitting 45(30) and Munsey ending on 41(31).
Pre-Game Insights: Scotland won the toss, with captain Richie Berrington opting to bat first in Barbados against an England line-up packed with pace options.
Post-Match Reflections: England have never beaten a European side at a Men’s T20 World Cup, and the rain ensured that record continued in Barbados.
Scotland will be rueing a missed opportunity to defend their decent total, and will hope to get a win on the board when they face Namibia on Thursday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain denied Scotland and England as Group B grudge match was abandoned.
A brief rain shower delayed the start of play by 30 minutes.
A second and heavier rain delay brought the match to a halt with Scotland 51/0 after 6.2 overs, forcing the game to be reduced to ten overs per side.
A third rain delay meant that the match was called off with no result possible.
England's next game is against Australia at the same venue on Saturday.
